author: Robin Appelman
message: I've been using it for a couple days, it's exactly what I've been looking for great work :)

author: eliasp
message:
This together with D-Bus-menu in 4.10 will replace plasma-netbook here…
Thanks a lot for your work!

author: K*Digest
message: Been using from the Kubuntu PPA for a while now. I love this! Getting better all the time.

author: dead
message:
This is really great, but there are little bugs (??) that I have noticed:
I am using a panel at the top of my screen, and If homerun is used as a containment, panel and Homerun's top bar (??- tabs) overlap. (see below screenshots)

2) If this useful tool is going to be used as a replacement/alternative for any other app launcher, I believe its icon should be configurable as well (for example, I use archlinux, and prefer an arch icon on it)

3) I don't know if this is a bug of homerun, or of the theme itself, but since no other plasmoid has this awkward colors I (maybe wrongly) assume that it is homeruns bug: When used with dark themes (the theme I use is caledonia), breadcrumb title become unreadble (white) until I move the mouse over onto them (please see the second screenshot).

Sorry, I didn't know where to post this in KDE bugtracker, so I chose to post this here instead.

Other than that, I believe this is a real replacement for kickoff and plasma netbook containment.
Great work. Thanks.

replies.author: Paul Clark
replies.message: I too have the exact same comments/issues.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message:
1) Yes, I noticed that, it used to size correctly at startup but not react to panel resizes, now it is the other way arround :/ This is https://bugs.kde.org/show_b...

2) Agreed. There is already a bug report for changing the launcher icon: https://bugs.kde.org/show_b...

3) Which version of kdelibs, kde-runtime do you use? There have been some fixes to QML Plasma Components in 4.9 with regards to dark themes.

replies.author: dead
replies.message:
Hello Aurélien,
I am using the latest stable KDE/Plasma: 4.9.3-2 (on archlinux)

replies.author: Markus S.
replies.message: I can confirm the dark theme bug on Plasma 4.9.3 with Oxygen theme.

author: xc
message:
"world-clock source showing time in
selected timezones": why not a source that displays a plasmoid (or a grid of them) ? then you could do your world clock... + many other things

author: dundee789
message: This is PEERFFEECT. I love this app. Just started using it about 5 mins ago and have already decided to replace my current launcher.

author: Lovestospooge
message: I have been waiting for this. Finally something that grants us the advantages of Gnome and Unity main menus, without everything that sucks about them.Aaaand it's already in AUR ! Marvelous ! Simply marvelous ! I cannot thank you enough !

author: fael
message:
Problems: user can not remove recent used documents
if you browse your directories with home run you don't have contextual menu to copy, paste, etc.. like you have in dolphin and it's a bit strange beacuse you are expecting it as usual.

replies.author: Markus S.
replies.message:
"user can not remove recent used documents"
You can. Click on the wrench icon in the upper right corner.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Agreed. We want to allow sources to define more than one action.

author: fael
message: Another problem is you have to click on the  homerun launcher to hide it, it does't  hide automatically when you click in other element of the desktop.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Right, but it goes away as soon as another window is focused, and that includes any Plasma popup applet such as the network or battery ones, so I don't see it as a serious issue. Or maybe you have a different setup where it is painful?

author: wstephenson
message: openSUSE has had packages in KDE:Unstable:Playground for a while: https://build.opensuse.org/...

replies.author: Markus S.
replies.message: That's outdated. Regularly updated versions are here: https://build.opensuse.org/...

replies.author: wstephenson
replies.message: Hm, it's using a git _service, should be *fresh*

replies.author: Markus S.
replies.message:
Playground: "_service:recompress:tar_scm:homerun-0.60git.1344527638.tar.bz2
Changed: 3 months ago"

home:rwooninck:UNSTABLE_KDE4: "_service:recompress:tar_scm:homerun-0.60git.1352816450.tar.bz2 Changed: 13 hours ago"

According to the changelog, service runs have to be triggered manually.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message:
Great to hear! I'd like to add one of those two repos to the blog post and homepage. Looks like home:rwooninck is the freshest. Do you confirm I should add this one?

Also, newbye OBS question: What does the "-0.60" stands for in "homerun-0.60git..."?

replies.author: Markus S.
replies.message:
Nah, better this link: http://software.opensuse.or...
It will list all versions available in openSUSE's repos.

As for 0.60: I'd guess that's just a randomly chosen prefix to have a version number smaller than 1.0. If the version number was e.g. the date of the git checkout, the package manager would think that the eventually released 1.0 version was a downgrade and not automatically do that. In hindsight 0.00.git.XY would've been a better choice, I'd guess, but whatever...

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message:
Thanks, just added this link to the blog and the homepage.

Regarding versions, I agree using 0.0.git would have made more sense.

author: davidedmundson
message:
Been using it for a while. 
Personally I've not been using it as a replacement for kickoff, but as a replacement for KRunner. It's easier to navigate, and much much prettier.Keep it up :)

author: ubuntupanther
message: Reminds me the dash button in ubuntu and KDE needed a button like this! Keep up the good work !

author: Markus S.
message: Great. Will future Plasma Netbook be based on Homerun?

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: There is a large thread going on on the plasma-devel mailing-list about (among other topics) where should Homerun go. For now Homerun has been developed as a 3rd party product, it may go to extragear or base in the future, once it is more mature.

author: rajendra thakur
message:
It is taking 50MB RAM on kubuntu 12.02 kde 4.9.2. Probably one can look at reducing the footprint.

Details taken from system monitor applet is the following.

Private    58200 KB    (= 2376 KB clean + 55824 KB dirty)
Shared    26780 KB    (= 23760 KB clean + 3020 KB dirty)
Rss    84980 KB    (= Private + Shared)
Pss    63012 KB    (= Private + Shared/Number of Processes)
Swap    0 KB

More details can be seen in the following paste.
http://paste.kde.org/607328/

author: Negofill
message:
Just amazing, now i found the alternative to lancelot and kickoff.
But, exist plans to add Drag and drop feature? just, drag a app icon in homerun and drop it in desktop or taskbar.
would be awesome.
i'm using opensuse 12.2 64 bits, Kde 4.9
Homerun version 0.60git.1347294448
Packege founded in Gnome: ayatana repositories
http://software.opensuse.or...

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Yes, we want to add drag'n'drop in the future.

author: Guest123
message:
O small off-topic:

What's the state of the Global Menu plasmoid in KDE?

Is there a place where i can keep an eye on its state?

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: I am not involved in it anymore. Cédric Bellegarde is the new maintainer. You can check the various appmenu git repositories from http://quickgit.kde.org/

author: rajendra thakur
message:
To add more to the memory footprint issue.

Upon fresh reboot it was taking 23MB. Upon launch it was taking 33 MB and after launching an application, it became 43 MB.
RES under top shows 69MB and 23MB.

author: gozo
message: looks cool. maybe you can import / adapt sources from the "gnome do" code base or  from the "kupfer" ( http://www.kaizer.se/wiki/k... ) code base.

author: Mtz
message:
I just tried and its treat but it taking the whole screen is not ideal as a desktop user with a large wide screen monitor.

It would be nice it could also be run not at full screen and with the option to set the dimensions it should be displayed in.

My ideal case would be for it to pop up at the center of the screen,in a wide screen dimensions with the size of my choosing.

replies.author: Markus S.
replies.message: Yeah,just like calendar when widgets are unlocked. Nice idea!

author: Kaxamurcia
message:
Simply: wonderful launcher.

But I noticed in the video that is impossible to read black texts when a dark wallpaper is being used... that bug looks very annoying. I remember that the default desktop theme use a white shadow/cloud/"whanever is called in the text background" to prevent that bug.

replies.author: Kaxamurcia
replies.message: At least in the container mode.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Yes, that is a current limitation of the Plasma QML components: they do not provide the same text shadow of their "classic" C++-based counterparts.

author: Fitzcarraldo
message: Looks similar to Takeoff launcher. What advantages does it offer?

replies.author: User581
replies.message: Yeah, that's what I was wondering.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Having used Takeoff a bit, I'd say Homerun is more customizable: you can create your own tabs with the content you want there. It also has the ability to browse your folders (and potentially any kind of hierarchy). Finally, it can run as a containment.

replies.author: Fauba
replies.message: its in active development.

author: b0b0lf0
message:
Im in love, you read my mind!!

Just some ideas:

- what about use kparts or write light, really light plugins to see pictures in some kind of embebed viewer?, the same for the audio files. That could be really nice.

author: Bugsbane
message: Recent folders! YES!!!! Now we just need to get this part into Dolphin... (At least the folders, part. Not the files part)

author: Hougelangley1987
message: So Great, Keep Going

author: od
message:
great launcher, some ideas ....
- make folder behaviour consistent across your categories (e.g "folder" list and "recent document" list), add a small dolphin icon underneath the bookmark icon of *all* folder icons).
- allow reordering of "favorites application" icons
- allow window resize a la "calendar"
- fix the duplicate path entry in the folder view that breaks navigation.
- allow changing the homerun icon.

keep the momentum up ...

author: Xavier
message: Hi  Aurélien Gâteau, thanks for this great app, but for me, only one thing I don't like, is impossible open folder or place with dolphin,  would be nice that It can to open a folder with dolphin with, for example, Ctrl+click.

author: gumb
message: Small thing: your new feed shows up with the generic title 'Recent blog posts'. You might want to change it to 'Aurélien's room' like the old one.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Fixed, thanks!

author: rajendra thakur
message:
Probably I am asking for a technically challenging aspect. It is a figment of my imagination.

Launchers (homerun, krunner etc) are not a forever running object for me and probably for many other people. Is it possible to hibernate them to a low resource consuming state and can be made to respond to the call quickly. I see krunner and homerun taking 11.7 and 28.7 MB all the time. This probably have to be implemented at the plasma level but this might also help the heavy usage by few other plasmoids/widgets and thus reduce the demands of plasma-desktop as well.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: I haven't tried anything around that, but if you are only using Homerun from the launcher and you think it is taking too much memory, then you can kill the homerunviewer binary. It will be restarted next time you click on the launcher (yes it's an ugly hack!)

author: Gustavo
message:
What is still needed to apply localisation configurations to it? Maybe some specific parts need a translation effort, but many terms are already available on KDE (Recent documents, Applications, Places...). Is it easy to apply to your plasmoid? It would be great, since it's useless for my parents, for example, without translation.

Even for me, it's a bit weird, since the translation problems cause some inconsistencies, mainly with Krunner stuff. If I, for instance, type "Desligar" in Krunner, it shows me the option to turn off my computer (“desligar” means that in Portuguese), but if I do the same in Homerun, it does nothing since it's in English and doesn't recognise such a word.

author: labatts
message:
This is great.  Just a suggestion:  It would be nice if the menu buttons would relocate based on where the widget icon is on the desktop.  So, for example, the icon is in the traditional place at the bottom left of my screen.  However, I have to mouse all the way to the top to get to the different categories.  Even having to move my eyes to the top right for the search bar is a reach. 

Otherwise, great.  I love the customisability of this.

author: rajendra thakur
message: Can homerun replace screenlocker functionality of krunner? Once I disabled krunner but was not able to screenlock so I had to reenable it.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: There is no plan to provide screen locking in Homerun. The good news is that in KDE SC 4.10, screen locking is no longer provided by KRunner.

author: Cjcanhoto
message:
Great work. Competing side-by-side with Kickoff and Krunner (but also with a "Search and Launch" activity) on my Kubuntu 12.10.

Some suggestions:

- Navigation through tabs with keyboard shortcuts, like arrow or tab keys; that would make the experience much better, without the need to use the mouse constantly
- Preview features in the files/folders section (previewing images, videos, etc.)
- Context menus for the files and apps
- The ability to choose which categories of apps should be showed (like in the "Search and Launch" widget or in takeoff), instead of just choosing between "All applications" or "Favorites".

But it really is a great work, which may successfully cross the Unity dash with the great advantages of KDE costumising.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message:
> Navigation using keyboard shortcuts
You can use ctrl+pageup, ctrl+pagedown. Look at the screencast, it demonstrates the keyboard shortcuts

> Context menu
It is in development

> Ability to choose which categories of apps should be shown
You can configure the "Installed Apps" source to show applications from a certain category. Is this what you want?

author: Volkan Gezer
message: How to help translate?

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Since Homerun is using KDE infrastructure, it is translated by the KDE translation team. If you are not involved in your local translation team, you can reach them here: http://l10n.kde.org/ . Homerun is in the playground/base translation package.
